trans-unit.source: Afterwards, this disconnected object graph and job function pointer is being added to jobs queue of the selected worker. Note that job must not capture any state itself, so that whole state is explicitly stored in object produced by producer. Scheduled job is being executed by the worker, and result of such a execution is being disconnected from worker's object graph. Whoever will consume the future, can use result of worker's computations. Note, that some technically disjoint subgraphs may lead to kotlin.IllegalStateException so kotlin.native.internal.GC.collect() could be called in the end of producer and job if garbage cyclic structures or other uncollected objects refer to the value being transferred.

trans-unit.source: Also each native binary is built in two variants (build types): debug (debuggable, not optimized) and release (not debuggable, optimized). Note that Kotlin/Native libraries have only debug variant because optimizations are preformed only during compilation of a final binary (executable, static lib etc) and affect all libraries used to build it.
trans-unit.target: 而且，每个本机二进制文件都以两种变体（构建类型）构建： debug （可调试，未优化）和 release （不可调试，未优化）。请注意，Kotlin / Native库仅具有 debug 变量，因为优化仅在编译最终二进制文件（可执行文件，静态库等）时执行，并且会影响用于构建它的所有库。

trans-unit.source: Also integer conversion functions, like Int.toString(), String.toInt(), String.toIntOrNull(), each got an overload with radix parameter, which allows to specify the base of conversion (2 to 36).
trans-unit.target: 同样，整数转换函数，例如 Int.toString() ， String.toInt() ， String.toIntOrNull() ，每个函数都有一个带有 radix 参数的重载，该重载可以指定转换的基数（2到36）。

trans-unit.source: Also it's possible to get a certain element of the collection. There are two ways to do this. First, each binary has a unique name. This name is based on the name prefix (if it's specified), build type and binary kind according to the following pattern: <optional-name-prefix><build-type><binary-kind>, e.g. releaseFramework or testDebugExecutable.
trans-unit.target: 也有可能获得集合的某个元素。有两种方法可以做到这一点。首先，每个二进制文件都有一个唯一的名称。该名称基于名称前缀（如果已指定），构建类型和二进制类型，并遵循以下模式： <optional-name-prefix><build-type><binary-kind> ，例如 releaseFramework 或 testDebugExecutable 。

trans-unit.source: Also migrating can be harder for larger teams because committing a lot of files in several subsystems may produce merging conflicts in personal branches. And while each conflict resolution is usually trivial, it's still wise to know if there are large feature branches currently in work.
trans-unit.target: 另外对于大型团队来说,迁移也会比较困难,因为在几个子系统中提交大量文件可能会产生个人分支的合并冲突。而每个冲突的解决通常都是小事一桩,但了解目前是否有大的功能分支在工作中还是很明智的。

trans-unit.source: Also, any C type has the Kotlin type representing the lvalue of this type, i.e., the value located in memory rather than a simple immutable self-contained value. Think C++ references, as a similar concept. For structs (and typedefs to structs) this representation is the main one and has the same name as the struct itself, for Kotlin enums it is named ${type}Var, for CPointer<T> it is CPointerVar<T>, and for most other types it is ${type}Var.
trans-unit.target: 同样，任何C类型的Kotlin类型都代表该类型的左值，即位于内存中的值，而不是简单的不可变的自包含值。将C ++引用视为类似的概念。对于结构体（和将 typedef 表示为结构体），此表示形式是主要的表示形式，并且与结构体本身具有相同的名称，对于Kotlin枚举，其表示为 ${type}Var ，对于 CPointer<T> 其表示为 CPointerVar<T> ，并且对于大多数其他类型，它是 ${type}Var 。

Also, pay attention to how we explicitly iterate over channel with for loop to perform fan-out in launchProcessor code. Unlike consumeEach, this for loop pattern is perfectly safe to use from multiple coroutines. If one of the processor coroutines fails, then others would still be processing the channel, while a processor that is written via consumeEach always consumes (cancels) the underlying channel on its normal or abnormal completion.
trans-unit.target: 另外，请注意我们如何使用 for 循环显式遍历通道以在 launchProcessor 代码中执行扇出操作。与 consumeEach 不同，此 for 循环模式可从多个协程安全使用。如果处理器协程之一发生故障，则其他协程仍将在处理该通道，而通过 consumeEach 编写的处理器总是在正常或异常完成时消耗（取消）基础通道。

trans-unit.source: Although C pointers are mapped to the CPointer<T> type, the C function pointer-typed parameters are mapped to CValuesRef<T>. When passing CPointer<T> as the value of such a parameter, it is passed to the C function as is. However, the sequence of values can be passed instead of a pointer. In this case the sequence is passed "by value", i.e., the C function receives the pointer to the temporary copy of that sequence, which is valid only until the function returns.
trans-unit.target: 尽管C指针映射到 CPointer<T> 类型，但是C函数指针类型的参数映射到 CValuesRef<T> 。当将 CPointer<T> 作为此类参数的值传递时，它将按原样传递给C函数。但是，可以传递值序列而不是指针。在这种情况下，序列“按值”传递，即C函数接收指向该序列的临时副本的指针，该指针仅在函数返回之前有效。

trans-unit.source: Although the scope functions are a way of making the code more concise, avoid overusing them: it can decrease your code readability and lead to errors. trans-unit.target: 尽管范围函数是使代码更简洁的一种方法，但请避免过度使用它们：这会降低代码的可读性并导致错误。避免嵌套作用域函数，并在链接它们时要小心：容易对当前上下文对象及其 this 或 it 的值感到困惑。

Among the flow transformation operators, the most general one is called transform. It can be used to imitate simple transformations like map and filter, as well as implement more complex transformations. Using the transform operator, we can emit arbitrary values an arbitrary number of times.

An actor is an entity made up of a combination of a coroutine, the state that is confined and encapsulated into this coroutine, and a channel to communicate with other coroutines. A simple actor can be written as a function, but an actor with a complex state is better suited for a class.
trans-unit.target: 的演员是一个协程，即被限制和封装到该协程的状态下，并与其他协同程序进行通信的信道的组合的组成的实体。可以将简单的actor编写为函数，但是状态复杂的actor更适合于类。

trans-unit.source: An important invariant that Kotlin/Native runtime maintains is that the object is either owned by a single thread/worker, or it is immutable (shared XOR mutable). This ensures that the same data has a single mutator, and so there is no need for locking to exist. To achieve such an invariant, we use the concept of not externally referred object subgraphs. This is a subgraph which has no external references from outside of the subgraph, which could be checked algorithmically with O(N) complexity (in ARC systems), where N is the number of elements in such a subgraph. Such subgraphs are usually produced as a result of a lambda expression, for example some builder, and may not contain objects, referred to externally.
trans-unit.target: Kotlin / Native运行时维护的一个重要不变式是该对象要么由单个线程/工人拥有，要么是不可变的（共享XOR可变）。这样可确保同一数据具有单个变量，因此无需存在锁定。为了实现这种不变性，我们使用了没有外部引用的对象子图的概念。这是一个子图，该子图没有来自子图外部的外部引用，可以使用O（N）复杂度（在ARC系统中）在算法上进行检查，其中N是此类子图中的元素数量。此类子图通常是由于lambda表达式（例如某些构造器）而产生的，并且可能不包含外部引用的对象。

If a property or function has a default implementation, the class may choose to override it, but it doesn't have to. Here's an interface without any default implementations:

trans-unit.source: An object subgraph without external references can be disconnected using DetachedObjectGraph<T> to a COpaquePointer value, which could be stored in void* data, so the disconnected object subgraphs can be stored in a C data structure, and later attached back with DetachedObjectGraph<T>.attach() in an arbitrary thread or a worker. Combining it with raw memory sharing it allows side channel object transfer between concurrent threads, if the worker mechanisms are insufficient for a particular task.

trans-unit.source: Another approach to debugging applications with threads without Coroutine Debugger is to print the thread name in the log file on each log statement. This feature is universally supported by logging frameworks. When using coroutines, the thread name alone does not give much of a context, so kotlinx.coroutines includes debugging facilities to make it easier.

trans-unit.source: Another crucial difference between regular and supervisor jobs is exception handling. Every child should handle its exceptions by itself via exception handling mechanisms. This difference comes from the fact that child's failure is not propagated to the parent.
trans-unit.target: 常规作业和主管作业的另一个关键区别是异常处理。每个子程序都应该通过异常处理机制自行处理其异常。这种区别来自于子程序的失败不会传播到父程序。

trans-unit.source: Another crucial difference between regular and supervisor jobs is exception handling. Every child should handle its exceptions by itself via the exception handling mechanism. This difference comes from the fact that child's failure does not propagate to the parent. It means that coroutines launched directly inside the supervisorScopedo use the CoroutineExceptionHandler that is installed in their scope in the same way as root coroutines do (see the CoroutineExceptionHandler section for details).
Another difference with catch operator is that onCompletion sees all exceptions and receives a null exception only on successful completion of the upstream flow (without cancellation or failure).
Another example is a server process that spawns multiple child jobs and needs to supervise their execution, tracking their failures and only restarting the failed ones.
Another example is a server process that spawns several children jobs and needs to supervise their execution, tracking their failures and restarting just those children jobs that had failed.
trans-unit.target: 另一个示例是一个服务器进程，它产生几个子作业，并需要监督它们的执行，跟踪其失败并仅重新启动那些失败的子作业。

trans-unit.source: Another filtering function – partition() – filters a collection by a predicate and keeps the elements that don't match it in a separate list. So, you have a Pair of Lists as a return value: the first list containing elements that match the predicate and the second one containing everything else from the original collection.
trans-unit.target: 另一个过滤函数 partition() –通过谓词过滤集合，并将不匹配的元素保留在单独的列表中。因此，您有一个 Pair 的 List 作为返回值：第一个列表包含与谓词匹配的元素，第二个列表包含原始集合中的所有其他内容。

trans-unit.source: Another flattening mode is to concurrently collect all the incoming flows and merge their values into a single flow so that values are emitted as soon as possible. It is implemented by flatMapMerge and flattenMerge operators. They both accept an optional concurrency parameter that limits the number of concurrent flows that are collected at the same time (it is equal to DEFAULT_CONCURRENCY by default).

Another function – flatMap() provides a flexible way to process nested collections. It takes a function that maps a collection element to another collection. As a result, flatMap() returns a single list of its return values on all the elements. So, flatMap() behaves as a subsequent call of map() (with a collection as a mapping result) and flatten().
trans-unit.target: 另一个函数– flatMap() 提供了一种处理嵌套集合的灵活方法。它需要一个将一个集合元素映射到另一个集合的函数。结果， flatMap() 在所有元素上返回其返回值的单个列表。因此， flatMap() 表现为 map() （以集合作为映射结果）和 flatten() 的后续调用。

trans-unit.source: Another way to remove elements from a collection is with the minusAssign (-=) operator – the in-place version of minus. The second argument can be a single instance of the element type or another collection. With a single element on the right-hand side, -= removes the first occurrence of it. In turn, if it's a collection, all occurrences of its elements are removed. For example, if a list contains duplicate elements, they are removed at once. The second operand can contain elements that are not present in the collection. Such elements don't affect the operation execution.
trans-unit.target: 从集合中删除元素的另一种方法是用 minusAssign （ -= ）运算符-就地版本的 minus 。第二个参数可以是元素类型的单个实例或另一个集合。对于右侧的单个元素， -= 删除该元素的第一个匹配项。反过来，如果它是一个集合，则所有出现的元素都将被删除。例如，如果列表包含重复元素，则将它们立即删除。第二个操作数可以包含集合中不存在的元素。这些元素不会影响操作执行。

Any attempt to use a suspending function in the finally block of the previous example causes CancellationException, because the coroutine running this code is cancelled. Usually, this is not a problem, since all well-behaving closing operations (closing a file, cancelling a job, or closing any kind of a communication channel) are usually non-blocking and do not involve any suspending functions. However, in the rare case when you need to suspend in a cancelled coroutine you can wrap the corresponding code in withContext(NonCancellable) {...} using withContext function and NonCancellable context as the following example shows:

trans-unit.source: Any reference in Java may be null, which makes Kotlin's requirements of strict null-safety impractical for objects coming from Java. trans-unit.source: Appending ::class to a class name will give you a KClass<C> metadata object for that class. The generic type parameter C is the class itself, so you can use KClass<*> if you're writing a function that can work with metadata for any class, or you can make a generic function with a type parameter T and parameter type KClass<T>. From this, you can obtain references to the members of the class. The most interesting properties on KClass are probably primaryConstructor, constructors, memberProperties, declaredMemberProperties, memberFunctions, and declaredMemberFunctions. The difference between e.g. memberProperties and declaredMemberProperties is that the former includes inherited properties, while the latter only includes the properties that have been declared in the class' own body.
trans-unit.target: 将 ::class 附加到类名将为您提供 KClass<C> 元数据对象。泛型类型参数 C 是类本身，因此，如果要编写可用于任何类的元数据的函数，则可以使用 KClass<*> ，也可以使用类型参数 T 和参数类型 KClass<T> 来创建泛型函数<T>。由此，您可以获得对类成员的引用。在最有趣的特性 KClass 可能是 primaryConstructor ， constructors ， memberProperties ， declaredMemberProperties ， memberFunctions ，以及 declaredMemberFunctions 。例如之间的差异 memberProperties 和 declaredMemberProperties 在于，前者包括继承属性，而后者只包括已经在类自己的身体被声明的属性。

trans-unit.source: Arrays
trans-unit.target: Arrays

trans-unit.source: Arrays are used with primitive datatypes on the Java platform to avoid the cost of boxing/unboxing operations. As Kotlin hides those implementation details, a workaround is required to interface with Java code. There are specialized classes for every type of primitive array (IntArray, DoubleArray, CharArray, and so on) to handle this case. They are not related to the Array class and are compiled down to Java's primitive arrays for maximum performance.
trans-unit.target: 数组与Java平台上的原始数据类型一起使用，以避免装箱/拆箱操作的成本。由于Kotlin隐藏了这些实现细节，因此需要一种解决方法来与Java代码交互。有专门的类为每一类型的基本数组的（ IntArray ， DoubleArray ， CharArray ，等等）来处理这种情况。它们与 Array 类无关，并被编译为Java的原始数组，以实现最佳性能。

trans-unit.source: Arrays as annotation parameters
trans-unit.target: 作为注释参数的数组

trans-unit.source: Arrays in Kotlin are invariant
trans-unit.target: Kotlin中的数组是不变的

trans-unit.source: Arrays in Kotlin are invariant. This means that Kotlin does not let us assign an Array<String> to an Array<Any>, which prevents a possible runtime failure (but you can use Array<out Any>, see Type Projections).

Arrays in Kotlin are invariant, unlike Java. This means that Kotlin does not let us assign an Array<String> to an Array<Any>, which prevents a possible runtime failure. Passing an array of a subclass as an array of superclass to a Kotlin method is also prohibited, but for Java methods this is allowed (through platform types of the form Array<(out) String>!).
trans-unit.target: 与Java不同，Kotlin中的数组是不变的。这意味着科特林没有让我们分配一个 Array<String> 到一个 Array<Any> ，这防止可能的运行时故障。也禁止将子类的数组作为超类的数组传递给Kotlin方法，但是对于Java方法，这是允许的（通过 Array<(out) String>! 形式的平台类型）。

trans-unit.source: Arrays in Kotlin are represented by the Array class, that has get and set functions (that turn into [] by operator overloading conventions), and size property, along with a few other useful member functions:
trans-unit.target: Kotlin中的 Array 由Array类表示，该类具有 get 和 set 函数（通过运算符重载约定变为 [] ）， size 属性以及一些其他有用的成员函数：

trans-unit.source: Arrays in Kotlin have a constant length, so one normally uses lists, which are similar to the ones in Python. What's called a dict in Python is called a map in Kotlin (not to be confused with the function map()). List, Map, and Set are all interfaces which are implemented by many different classes. In most situations, a standard array-backed list or hash-based map or set will do, and you can easily make those like this:

trans-unit.source: As assembling Kotlin/Native artifacts requires several builds to run on different host platforms, publishing a multiplatform library that includes Kotlin/Native targets needs to be done with that same set of host machines. To avoid duplicate publications of modules that can be built on more than one of the platforms (like JVM, JS, Kotlin metadata, WebAssembly), the publishing tasks for these modules may be configured to run conditionally.
trans-unit.target: 由于组装Kotlin/Native工件需要多次构建才能在不同的主机平台上运行,所以发布一个包含Kotlin/Native目标的多平台库需要用同一套主机来完成。为了避免重复发布可以在多个平台上构建的模块(如JVM、JS、Kotlin元数据、WebAssembly),可以将这些模块的发布任务配置为有条件运行。

trans-unit.source: As legacy features get removed and bugs fixed, the source language changes, and old code that has not been properly migrated may not compile any more. The normal deprecation cycle allows a comfortable period of time for migration, and even when it's over and the change ships in a stable version, there's still a way to compile unmigrated code.
trans-unit.target: 随着遗留功能的删除和bug的修复,源码语言也会发生变化,没有被正确迁移的旧代码可能无法再编译。正常的废弃周期可以给迁移留出一段舒适的时间,即使迁移结束,变更后的稳定版本出货,也有办法编译未迁移的代码。

trans-unit.source: As opposed to Python, omitting return at the end of a function does not implicitly return null; if you want to return null, you must do so with return null. If a function never needs to return anything, the function should have the return type Unit (or not declare a return type at all, in which case the return type defaults to Unit). In such a function, you may either have no return statement at all, or say just return. Unit is both a singleton object (which None in Python also happens to be) and the type of that object, and it represents "this function never returns any information" (rather than "this function sometimes returns information, but this time, it didn't", which is more or less the semantics of returning null).
trans-unit.target: 与Python相反，在函数末尾省略 return 不会隐式返回null；如果要返回null，则必须使用 return null 。如果一个函数永远不需要返回任何东西，则该函数应该具有返回类型 Unit （或者根本不声明返回类型，在这种情况下，返回类型默认为 Unit ）。在这样的函数中，您可能根本没有 return 语句，或者只说 return 。 Unit 都是单例对象（ None 在Python中也恰好是该对象的类型），它表示“此函数从不返回任何信息”（而不是“此函数有时返回信息，但这次却不返回信息”），或多或少返回null的语义）。

trans-unit.source: As said above, type erasure makes checking actual type arguments of a generic type instance impossible at runtime, and generic types in the code might be connected to each other not closely enough for the compiler to ensure type safety.

trans-unit.source: As the definition of list says, a list is an ordered collection. Hence, every element of a list has its position that you can use for referring. In addition to functions described on this page, lists offer a wider set of ways to retrieve and search for elements by indices. For more details, see List Specific Operations.
trans-unit.target: 正如list的定义所言，列表是有序集合。因此，列表中的每个元素都有其位置可供您参考。除了此页面上描述的功能外，列表还提供了一组更广泛的方法来按索引检索和搜索元素。有关更多详细信息，请参见列出特定操作。
